alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 2:37PM CST until February 26 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Harpeth River At Bellevue affecting Williamson and Davidson Counties. For the Harpeth River...including Bellevue...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Harpeth River At Bellevue. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water reaches the club house of the Harpeth Valley Golf Center. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CST Friday the stage was 17.8 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 4.5 feet Wednesday morning. - Action stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 900 AM CST.
